title: What is the main purpose of social studies? - Quora

response.answer_text: We can only grow up in one tiny culture and during one time in history. If a student does not receive a broad view of cultures throughout time they will get the wrong impression of the stability of their own… and worse. Information without context leads to misapprehension. It’s freakin’ crazy to skip Social Studies! How’s that for an abrupt change in tone? How would this paragraph be interpreted outside of this forum? How would it have been seen 400 years ago? How would you have a clue about these questions if you had no social studies. You’d be a “mighty weak” individual without it. And if you’d not have studied the language you’d not know what an oxymoron is. The main purpose of any study is to give information context. No single subject exists in isolation, nor does any single fact. You cannot have a world composed of 7 billion specialists, it won’t work. It’s kinda falling apart right now… Have you a better picture of social studies importance with this brief pointing of a finger towards the truth? I hope so ;-)

The social sciences are a very salient academic, and arguably-’ a real life’ endeavor. In a global economy and international inter-connectivity, one must be aware of others social status and the commonalities and differences that are shared or not shared. One should strive to learn about their own country, state, and region, along with other countries, and their cultures, socio-economics, social stratus, religious traditions, and their military aspirations. It is not wise to always rely on other people’s opinions or news or media reports. It helps to have a general idea of how an individual might think and why he or she thinks that way. The social sciences are a very broad academic field, incorporating geography, history, world history, sociology, psychology, politics, and etc.
